messages: 8d5b843f8613182cd679d2e5e504d0e3 (09:08): I got about 10 inserts I would like to put in 1 query, is that possible?
8d5b843f8613182cd679d2e5e504d0e3 (09:08): Or should I just query each one separately?
320325ac497ba00e9b23811edfda82f0 (09:09): INSERT INTO table ( col1, col2 ) VALUES ('val1','val2'), ('val3','val4'), ('val5','val6')
8d5b843f8613182cd679d2e5e504d0e3 (09:13): I think that should do it
8d5b843f8613182cd679d2e5e504d0e3 (09:17): is there a limit on query length?
8d5b843f8613182cd679d2e5e504d0e3 (09:19): hmm then I'll have to separate my insert into multiple inserts
8d5b843f8613182cd679d2e5e504d0e3 (09:21): My system is selling to idiots
8d5b843f8613182cd679d2e5e504d0e3 (09:21): dont want them bothering me later with it
320325ac497ba00e9b23811edfda82f0 (09:21): That's probably the best reason I have ever heard.
8d5b843f8613182cd679d2e5e504d0e3 (09:22): im seeing quite the amount of wills today
320325ac497ba00e9b23811edfda82f0 (09:23): Where there is a will, there is a way.
8d5b843f8613182cd679d2e5e504d0e3 (09:23): with the last will, it wasn't an easy way ;-p
dc8738f2e5e93ea2b50c2db14f7be0d5 (09:37): i mean the other left <-")
63d0796684121fe89940a712eda6ed69 (09:52): If i try to run mssql and mysql on the same box am I going to run into any problems
8d5b843f8613182cd679d2e5e504d0e3 (10:03): and I dont know if you'll run into problems
8d5b843f8613182cd679d2e5e504d0e3 (10:03): you know.. theres only one way to find out..
8d5b843f8613182cd679d2e5e504d0e3 (10:03): .. and thats to go ask in #mssql as well
68ad985e21342c4d442c0320b7e6025d (10:08): i had a little table join wich was working fine and fast, until i put a little or clause in there, is there any way to keep in and still use the indices
68ad985e21342c4d442c0320b7e6025d (10:11): so basically b.id and c.id are supposed to be either NULL or match with the other thing
68ad985e21342c4d442c0320b7e6025d (10:11): if i take the is null condition out the optimizer uses the codex
81db21118163cdf085f0a0034d2b2672 (10:24): dts if 5.*, try FORCE INDEX; if 4.*, try 2 subqueries and UNION.
68ad985e21342c4d442c0320b7e6025d (10:25): where do i put the "FORCE INDEX"
